thread.title: 3 track bets to train in Australia
thread.title_full: 3 track bets to train in Australia | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Jonas Terrado
title: 3 track bets to train in Australia
text:
by Jonas Terrado
October 21, 2015 (updated) The Philippine Athletics Track and Field Association (PATAFA) will send three promising athletes to Perth, Australia this month for training aimed not only at qualifying for next year’s Rio Olympics but also for the 2020 Tokyo Games.
Two-time Southeast Asian Games gold medalist Christopher Ulboc, Singapore SEAG bronze winner Edgardo Alejan and Mervin Guarte will spend three months in Perth to prepare for three continental events prior to the 2020 Olympics.
These are the 2017 SEAG in Malaysia, 2018 Asian Games in Indonesia and the 2019 SEAG which the country is expected to host.
PATAFA President Philip Ella Juico, speaking at the PSA Forum yesterday, said the plan is a “mixture of short term and long term goals” for the three athletes.
Juico also announced that the country will host the Asian Athletics Association (AAA) Council Meeting on Oct. 25 to 27 at the Solaire Resort and Casino.
Juico said Asian athletic heads from 20 countries will be arriving.
